public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 7 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G from smallest (A) to largest (G).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G; left and middle pegs are empty.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in creating PDDL domains and problems suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Using the local contexts supplied by the peg agents, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the Tower of Hanoi instance with 7 disks and three pegs. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards requirements. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Make sure predicates and actions are fully specified, include appropriate :requirements, :types if needed, :constants, :init, and :goal sections, and ensure the resulting planning problem captures the rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Keep agent roles distinct only if needed; the important output is a correct single-agent PDDL representation that FastDownwards can solve.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You receive the following contexts from agents: {context_left}, {context_middle}, {context_right}. Your orchestrator goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the contexts, resolve any naming mismatches, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem for the FastDownwards solver that achieves the goal of moving the full ordered stack from left to right under the standard Tower of Hanoi constraints. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
